meanings.definition: The quality or state of being untrue or deceptive.
meanings.sent1: The falseness of his promises was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the falseness in his words.
meanings.sent3: The falseness of the magician's tricks made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The falseness of the situation hit her like a ton of bricks.
meanings.sent5: The falseness of the painting was revealed under the bright light.

meanings.sent1: His speech was full of falseness that no one believed.
meanings.sent2: She regretted spreading falseness about her friend.
meanings.sent3: The falseness in his excuse was so obvious it was comical.
meanings.sent4: The falseness of his words stung like a slap in the face.
meanings.sent5: The falseness of the rumor spread like wildfire through the town.
